### Signal Plot
```{python}
#| echo: false
import plotly.express as px
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# 1. Create fake sensor data (Time vs Voltage)
t = np.linspace(0, 5, 500)
v = np.sin(2 * np.pi * t) + np.random.normal(0, 0.1, 500)
df = pd.DataFrame({'Seconds': t, 'Voltage (mV)': v})

# 2. Make it dynamic using Plotly
fig = px.line(df, x='Seconds', y='Voltage (mV)', title="Real-time Sensor Simulation")

# 3. Display it
fig.show()
